course.name: Done is better - Build What Matters

questions.question: A team tracks "page views" for a goal that is "increase conversions." What is wrong?
options: Page views may be a vanity metric; use a metric that directly reflects the goal

questions.question: In this framework, how is "measure what matters" defined?
options: Track outcomes that affect the goal, not vanity metrics
Measure only cost and not outcomes
Measure only once at the end

questions.question: How do you choose a metric for a goal?
options: Identify one metric that directly reflects success; define how you will get the data and how often you will check it

questions.question: Using data only to justify after the fact (not to decide) leads to:
options: Decisions driven by bias; data becomes theater

questions.question: Opinion over data when both are available can result in:
options: Decisions that ignore evidence and repeat past mistakes

questions.question: What should you define for a metric besides the number?
options: How you will get the data and how often you will check it; baseline and target if possible

questions.question: Why avoid vanity metrics?
options: They mislead; they do not reflect the goal
